name: Titanium.App.iOS.SearchQuery
summary: A search query object manages the criteria to apply when searching app content that you have previously indexed by using the Core Spotlight APIs.

events.name: founditems
events.summary: Fired when the query finds a new batch of matching items.

properties.name: items
properties.summary: An array of indexed items that match the specified query.

properties.name: foundItemsCount
properties.summary: The number of items that are currently fetched.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: completed
events.summary: Fired when the query completes to inform you about it's success. To receive items, use the founditems event.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates if the operation succeeded. Returns true if download succeeded, false otherwise.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. Undefined otherwise.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: isCancelled
methods.summary: A Boolean value that indicates if the query has been cancelled (true) or not (false).

methods.name: start
methods.summary: Asynchronously queries the index for items that match the query object's specifications.

properties.name: attributes
properties.summary: An array of strings that represent the attributes of indexed items.
properties.description: Each string corresponds to a property name that can be set for an item. For a list of possible properties, see the Titanium.App.iOS.SearchableItemAttributeSet API. Passing null for this parameter means that the query does not use attributes to find matching items.

properties.name: queryString
properties.summary: A formatted string that defines the matching criteria to apply to indexed items.
